title: Thunderbird AppData data is much larger than the equivalent Outlook .pst data
content:
Outlook is used on one PC with POP3 data retrieval. Messages are only deleted by the email service provider if they are deleted in Outlook.

Thunderbird is also used to access the same accounts with IMAP access to the online accounts. All of the messages online have been downloaded by Thunderbird.

I am comparing the .pst Outlook files, and the various Thunderbird data files stored by the PC.

The Thunderbird data files are much larger than the Outlook files. For example, the largest Outlook .pst file is 2G. But there is a Thunderbird data file that is 8G.

Any reason or problem or cleanup suggestion regarding 20G of Outlook .pst data that appears as 30G of Thunderbird locally stored downloaded IMAP data?

John
creator: ffx5

title: Email Notifications in 128.2.1
content: With version 128, now when I open Thunderbird, I get a notification alert and sound for every new email. If I have 20 new emails, I get 20 notification alerts and sounds. Very annoying. The previous version would have one notification saying I have 20 unread emails. Much better.
creator: bobe624

title: Email message responses.
content:
I can't find the answer online. When I receive an email message and then several other people respond to the message, how shd I set up TB so the messages responding to the original message appear on my screen with the most recent one at the top of the list of responses?

Many thanks.
creator: a2r32000

title: Thunderbird
content: Recently while tracking down a problem with my Optus email account regarding a message stating that my quota of storage was reaching maximum, a Optus "tech" advised that I should change mr port number in my Thunderbird account and this has resulted in the now present fault condition. I can send emails from this PC without any problems but cannot receive any. I am sending this message from another PC thyat does not have this problem. What is the correct number for the port. I have uninstalled and reinstalled Thunderbird on the problem PC, even ded a system restore without success. Send OK, no receive. Help. Cheers, Gordon Shaw
creator: Music1492maN

title: Non-Junk Filter Isn't Working
content: Recently a lot of mailing-list emails that I do I want to get kept ending up in my Junk folders. So I started setting up filters, and now the problem is worse than before. The attached screen grab image shows an example. I've been on Bud's Art Books mailing list for about two years. When their emails starting going into my Junk folder, I set this "Not-Junk" filter up as shown. But now every email I get from Bud's ends up in my Junk folder. This is happening with dozens of emails I get daily from groups and vendors that I do want to see. I've set up this same "Not Junk" filter for all of them, and they all continue to go to Junk. Is there something wrong with the filter settings I'm using? TIA for any help on this.
creator: jim265

title: Why is this asking for my windows password?
content:
New computer setup. Fresh install of windows 10 and the latest TB.

Turning primary password on like I always have, its now telling me I need to use my windows password as my primary. Who really sat down and thought this through and thought this was a good idea and then coded it into the platform? How do I use whatever password I want and get rid of this asinine default behavior.
creator: jc73

title: New T'bird is showing WRONG correspondent.
content: New T'bird is showing WRONG correspondent. Email from quickbooks show the wrong correspondent. They show the first correspondent that used quickbooks Company A uses quickbooks and their emails say Company A. When Company B and Company C send an invoice using quickbooks, it shows as coming from Company A.
creator: MarkinIdaho

title: Manually add new login info into Thunderbird's password manager?
content: Thunderbird doesn't always save logins/passwords. Is there a way to manually add a new site & password into the saved passwords?
